alert.note: Alert for Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 4:35PM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Hanford CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Merced River...including Pohono Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Pohono Bridge. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Western portion of North Pines Campground located at the east end of Yosemite Valley between the confluence of the Merced River and Tenaya Creek begins to flood. Water rises to the base of the swinging bridge downstream from Chapel Meadow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM PDT Sunday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 10.2 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. It is forecast to rise back above flood stage again Monday night. The river could reach as high as 13 feet by early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...Tonight`s crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 06/09/1978. Higher crests will be possible through the week as more snow melts. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1000 AM PDT.
